Documentation des constructeurs et destructeur
__construct() __constructImap Imap__construct
__construct ( $host = '' , $port = null , $ssl = false , $novalidatecert = false )
Public constructor
Paramètres
string$host
hostname or IP address of IMAP server, if given connect() is called
int | null$port
port of IMAP server, null for default (143 or 993 for ssl)
string | bool$ssl
use ssl? 'SSL', 'TLS' or false
bool$novalidatecert
set to true to skip SSL certificate validation
Exceptions
Laminas\Mail\Protocol\Exception\ExceptionInterface Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :

Documentation des fonctions membres
append() appendImap Imapappend
append ( $folder, $message, $flags = null , $date = null )
append a new message to given folder
Paramètres
string$folder
name of target folder
string$message
full message content
array$flags
flags for new message
string$date
date for new message
Renvoie
bool success
Exceptions
Laminas\Mail\Protocol\Exception\ExceptionInterface Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :
assumedNextLine() assumedNextLineImap ImapassumedNextLine
assumedNextLine ( $start)[protected]
get next line and assume it starts with $start. some requests give a simple feedback so we can quickly check if we can go on.
Paramètres
string$start
the first bytes we assume to be in the next line
Renvoie
bool line starts with $start

copy() copyImap Imapcopy
copy ( $folder, $from, $to = null )
copy message set from current folder to other folder
Paramètres
string$folder
destination folder
$from
int | null$to
if null only one message ($from) is fetched, else it's the last message, INF means last message available
Renvoie

decodeLine() decodeLineImap ImapdecodeLine
decodeLine ( $line)[protected]
split a given line in tokens. a token is literal of any form or a list
Paramètres
string$line
line to decode
Renvoie
array tokens, literals are returned as string, lists as array

examineOrSelect() examineOrSelectImap ImapexamineOrSelect
examineOrSelect ( $command = 'EXAMINE' , $box = 'INBOX' )
Examine and select have the same response. The common code for both is in this method
Paramètres
string$command
can be 'EXAMINE' or 'SELECT' and this is used as command
string$box
which folder to change to or examine
Renvoie
bool|array false if error, array with returned information otherwise (flags, exists, recent, uidvalidity)
Exceptions
Laminas\Mail\Protocol\Exception\ExceptionInterface Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :

expunge() expungeImap Imapexpunge
expunge ( )
permanently remove messages
Renvoie
bool success
Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :
fetch() fetchImap Imapfetch
fetch ( $items, $from, $to = null , $uid = false )
fetch one or more items of one or more messages
Paramètres
string | array$items
items to fetch from message(s) as string (if only one item) or array of strings
int | array$from
message for items or start message if $to !== null
int | null$to
if null only one message ($from) is fetched, else it's the last message, INF means last message available
bool$uid
set to true if passing a unique id
Exceptions
Exception
RuntimeException Renvoie
string|array if only one item of one message is fetched it's returned as string if items of one message are fetched it's returned as (name => value) if one items of messages are fetched it's returned as (msgno => value) if items of messages are fetched it's returned as (msgno => (name => value))
Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :
listMailbox() listMailboxImap ImaplistMailbox
listMailbox ( $reference = '' , $mailbox = '*' )
get mailbox list
this method can't be named after the IMAP command 'LIST', as list is a reserved keyword
Paramètres
string$reference
mailbox reference for list
string$mailbox
mailbox name match with wildcards
Renvoie
array mailboxes that matched $mailbox as array(globalName => array('delim' => .., 'flags' => ..))
Exceptions
Laminas\Mail\Protocol\Exception\ExceptionInterface Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :

nextTaggedLine() nextTaggedLineImap ImapnextTaggedLine
nextTaggedLine (& $tag)[protected]

string$tag
tag of line is returned by reference

noop() noopImap Imapnoop

Renvoie

Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :
readLine() readLineImap ImapreadLine
readLine (& $tokens = [] , $wantedTag = '*' , $dontParse = false )
read a response "line" (could also be more than one real line if response has {..}<NL>) and do a simple decode
Paramètres
array | string$tokens
decoded tokens are returned by reference, if $dontParse is true the unparsed line is returned here
string$wantedTag
check for this tag for response code. Default '*' is continuation tag.
bool$dontParse
if true only the unparsed line is returned $tokens
Renvoie
bool if returned tag matches wanted tag
Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :
Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :
readResponse() readResponseImap ImapreadResponse
readResponse ( $tag, $dontParse = false )
read all lines of response until given tag is found (last line of response)
Paramètres
string$tag
the tag of your request
bool$dontParse
if true every line is returned unparsed instead of the decoded tokens
Renvoie
null|bool|array tokens if success, false if error, null if bad request

string$new

requestAndResponse() requestAndResponseImap ImaprequestAndResponse
requestAndResponse ( $command, $tokens = [] , $dontParse = false )
send a request and get response at once
Paramètres
string$command
command as in sendRequest()
array$tokens
parameters as in sendRequest()
bool$dontParse
if true unparsed lines are returned instead of tokens
Renvoie
mixed response as in readResponse()

This method is currently marked as internal as the API might change and is not safe if you don't take precautions.

Renvoie

sendRequest() sendRequestImap ImapsendRequest
sendRequest ( $command, $tokens = [] , & $tag = null )
send a request
Paramètres
string$command
your request command
array$tokens
additional parameters to command, use escapeString() to prepare
string$tag
provide a tag otherwise an autogenerated is returned
Exceptions
Exception
RuntimeException Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :
Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :
store() storeImap Imapstore
store (array $flags, $from, $to = null , $mode = null , $silent = true )
set flags
Paramètres
array$flags
flags to set, add or remove - see $mode
int$from
message for items or start message if $to !== null
int | null$to
if null only one message ($from) is fetched, else it's the last message, INF means last message available
string | null$mode
'+' to add flags, '-' to remove flags, everything else sets the flags as given
bool$silent
if false the return values are the new flags for the wanted messages
Renvoie
bool|array new flags if $silent is false, else true or false depending on success
Exceptions
Laminas\Mail\Protocol\Exception\ExceptionInterface Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :
subscribe() subscribeImap Imapsubscribe
subscribe ( $folder)
subscribe to a folder
Paramètres
string$folder
folder name
Renvoie
bool success
